  3/** @file    vsip/core/counter.hpp
  4    @author  Zack Weinberg
  5    @date    2005-01-21
  6    @brief   VSIPL++ Library: Checked counter classes.
  7 
  8    This file defines classes useful in use and reference counting.  */
  9
 10#ifndef VSIP_CORE_COUNTER_HPP
 11#define VSIP_CORE_COUNTER_HPP
 12
 13/***********************************************************************
 14  Included Files
 15***********************************************************************/
 16
 17#include <vsip/support.hpp>
 18
 19/***********************************************************************
 20  Declarations
 21***********************************************************************/
 22
 23namespace vsip
 24{
 25/// All VSIPL++ internal interfaces live in namespace \c vsip::impl.
 26namespace impl
 27{
 28
 29/// A Checked_counter wraps an unsigned int with operator functions that
 30/// notice over- or underflow and throw appropriate exceptions.
 31/// Multiplication, division, and bitwise operations are not supported.
 32struct Checked_counter
 33{
 34  /// This typedef centralizes the choice of underlying type.  It is
 35  /// public because it may be useful to users of this class: for instance,
 36  /// one may wish to refer to std::numeric_limits<Checked_counter::value_type>.
 37  typedef unsigned int value_type;
 38  
 39private:
 40  /// Underlying value.
 41  value_type val;
 42
 43  /// Out-of-line function called when overflow is detected; does not return.
 44  static void overflow(value_type a, value_type b) VSIP_IMPL_NORETURN;
 45
 46  /// Out-of-line function called when underflow is detected; does not return.
 47  static void underflow(value_type a, value_type b) VSIP_IMPL_NORETURN;
 48
 49public:
 50  /// Default constructor, initializes a counter to 0.
 51  Checked_counter() VSIP_NOTHROW : val(0) {}
 52  
 53  /// Constructor from a value.
 54  Checked_counter(value_type v) VSIP_NOTHROW : val(v) {}
 55
 56  /// Extract-value function.
 57  /// There is no operator value_type because we don't want
 58  /// implicit conversions losing the checkedness.
 59  value_type value() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return val; }
 60
 61  // The implicit C++ copy constructor and operator= are correct for
 62  // this class.
 63
 64  // Primitive arithmetic operations:
 65  /// Destructive add.
 66  inline Checked_counter operator+=(const Checked_counter x);
 67
 68  /// Destructive subtract.
 69  inline Checked_counter operator-=(const Checked_counter x);
 70  
 71  // Arithmetic operations defined in terms of the primitives:
 72  /// Prefix increment.
 73  Checked_counter operator++() { return *this += 1; }
 74
 75  /// Prefix decrement.
 76  Checked_counter operator--() { return *this -= 1; }
 77
 78  /// Postfix increment.
 79  Checked_counter operator++(int)
 80    { Checked_counter old = *this; *this += 1; return old; }
 81
 82  /// Postfix decrement.
 83  Checked_counter operator--(int)
 84    { Checked_counter old = *this; *this -= 1; return old; }
 85
 86  /// Nondestructive add.
 87  Checked_counter operator+(Checked_counter x) const
 88    { Checked_counter r = *this; r += x; return r; }
 89
 90  /// Nondestructive subtract.
 91  Checked_counter operator-(Checked_counter x) const
 92    { Checked_counter r = *this; r -= x; return r; }
 93
 94#define NC const VSIP_NOTHROW // shorthand
 95  
 96  // Logical operations:
 97
 98  // There is no operator bool, because that could be used to convert
 99  // to value_type as well, resulting in truncation of the actual value.
100  bool operator==(const Checked_counter x) NC { return val == x.val; }
101  bool operator!=(const Checked_counter x) NC { return val != x.val; }
102  bool operator> (const Checked_counter x) NC { return val >  x.val; }
103  bool operator< (const Checked_counter x) NC { return val <  x.val; }
104  bool operator<=(const Checked_counter x) NC { return val <= x.val; }
105  bool operator>=(const Checked_counter x) NC { return val >= x.val; }
106
107#undef NC
108};
109
110// The nondestructive arithmetic and logical operators have to be
111// repeated as non-member functions with a Checked_counter:value_type left
112// argument.
113inline Checked_counter
114operator+(Checked_counter::value_type x, const Checked_counter y)
115{ Checked_counter r = x; r += y; return r; }
116
117inline Checked_counter
118operator-(Checked_counter::value_type x, const Checked_counter y)
119{ Checked_counter r = x; r -= y; return r; }
120
121inline bool
122operator==(Checked_counter::value_type x, const Checked_counter y) VSIP_NOTHROW
123{ return x == y.value(); }
124
125inline bool
126operator!=(Checked_counter::value_type x, const Checked_counter y) VSIP_NOTHROW
127{ return x != y.value(); }
128
129inline bool
130operator< (Checked_counter::value_type x, const Checked_counter y) VSIP_NOTHROW
131{ return x <  y.value(); }
132
133inline bool
134operator> (Checked_counter::value_type x, const Checked_counter y) VSIP_NOTHROW
135{ return x >  y.value(); }
136
137inline bool
138operator<=(Checked_counter::value_type x, const Checked_counter y) VSIP_NOTHROW
139{ return x <= y.value(); }
140
141inline bool
142operator>=(Checked_counter::value_type x, const Checked_counter y) VSIP_NOTHROW
143{ return x >= y.value(); }
144
145inline Checked_counter
146Checked_counter::operator+=(Checked_counter x)
147{
148  value_type sum = val + x.val;
149
150  if (sum < val)
151    overflow(val, x.val);  // does not return
152
153  val = sum;
154  return *this;
155}
156
157inline Checked_counter
158Checked_counter::operator-=(Checked_counter x)
159{
160  value_type diff = val - x.val;
161
162  if (diff > val)
163    underflow(val, x.val);  // does not return
164
165  val = diff;
166  return *this;
167}
168
169} // namespace vsip::impl
170} // namespace vsip
171
172#endif // VSIP_CORE_COUNTER_HPP
